main event: On 18 February 1950, an observer reported a sighting of a round, red and blue object that appeared to move side to side and up and down, remaining stationary for a duration of one to eleven minutes.
interesting points: The object changed color from red to white and back again during the observation., The observer thought the object was a star initially, but was not satisfied with this explanation., One object appeared to be moving fast and exhibited interference., The object was described to be about 80 feet long and giving off a dull metallic appearance., The sighting drew the interest of both an adult and a child, indicating multi-generational observation.
